subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] I have a question.
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I have a recording provided to me by some people whose house is supposedly
haunted. The recording is of a couple messages left on their landline phone
answering machine. The messages are mostly garbled and unintelligible. I've
tried every method of processing them to try to bring out the words in the
messages, mostly with no luck (that's how distorted they are.) I was able to
hear "This is your father ..." in one message and "I love you very much very
much" in another.

The people suspect the house is haunted by their father and mother, who
both passed away within 6 months of these messages. It could very well be.

Zack

>> neighborhood talked directly to me, although for me it sounded like they
>> were in a tin can.   There is plenty of other stuff coming through as well,
>> what do I care if people don't believe this, I do because, I know this is
>> meant to be, and I am sure of it it's going to be something for other's like
>> seeing is believing and there is nothing we can do for them, it's like the
>> Wright Brother's flying for the first time here people, they said how in the

>> machine will be found to make them come in loud and clear one day.  sf*
>>
>>  In a message dated 5/18/2009 9:13:25 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,
>> evanduzer@... writes:
>>
>>
>>
>> Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way of doing things.  I do
>> clean up evps if I hear something and can't make it out do to ambient
>> noise.  So hear is my question.  When do you stop cleaning up?  Wouldn't to
>> much enhancing "taint" the results?  To me the more enhancing you do the
>> less convincing it becomes.  I hope no one finds this offensive, it is not
>> meant to be I am just really curious.  The way I look at it is that if you
>> have to do so much enhancing to find anything, was there really something
>> there to begin with.  Are we just making ourselves believe there is
>> something there??
>>
>> Eric
>>
